Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Influence of EVD Laterality on Intraventricular Hemorrhage Clearance

Participants.evidence: Participants were eligible if they had obstructive IVH and were randomised to receive thrombolytic agents or placebo via EVD.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive thrombolytic agents or placebo via EVD

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of EVD laterality on blood clearance from the ventricular system, with and without thrombolytic agents.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of IVH clearance over the first 3 days, assessed by CT scans.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment through sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis, with 98 participants in the thrombolytic group and 97 in the placebo group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Thrombolytic administration significantly improved IVH clearance compared to placebo, regardless of EVD laterality (p < 0.005, CI −14.0, −4.14 for contralateral and CI −24.7, −5.44 for ipsilateral EVD).
